article.headline: Dartmouth 80, Harvard 73 (OT)
article.story: HANOVER, N.H. (AP) -- Leon Pattman scored 22 of his 27 points after halftime to help Dartmouth open the Ivy League season with an 80-73 overtime victory over Harvard Saturday night. Alex Barnett added 19 points and 10 rebounds for Dartmouth (6-7, 1-0 Ivy League), which trailed 35-23 at the half. DeVon Mosley added 12 points as the Big Green won for the sixth time in seven games. Brian Cusworth made 15-of-19 free throws to lead Harvard (7-8, 0-1) with 25 points, 15 rebounds and four blocks. Evan Harris added 12 points and 11 rebounds for the Crimson, which lost its fourth straight. Dartmouth took its first lead of the game at 62-61, when Pattman made a twisting layup with 2:40 to play. His fast-break bucket made it 64-61 before Jim Goffredo's 3-pointer with 1:53 left tied it. When Cusworth's turnaround shot to win at the buzzer went off the back rim, the game went to overtime. Dartmouth made 6-of-7 shots from the field in the extra session with Pattman scoring seven. The Big Green beat Harvard for just the third time in the last 15 tries. The teams meet again Friday at Harvard.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
